title: Component presence and imports
description: Verify that all required components exist, export correctly, and can be imported without TypeScript errors: Navbar, Hero, Problem, Solution, Features, HowItWorks, Pricing, FAQ, ContactModal, SmoothScroller, and lib/store.

steps.description: Run a TypeScript compile (tsc --noEmit) in the project root.
Compilation completes with zero type errors.

In a test harness file, import each component and the zustand store: components/layout/Navbar.tsx, components/sections/Hero.tsx, components/sections/Problem.tsx, components/sections/Solution.tsx, components/sections/Features.tsx, components/sections/HowItWorks.tsx, components/sections/Pricing.tsx, components/sections/FAQ.tsx, components/ui/ContactModal.tsx, components/layout/SmoothScroller.tsx, lib/store.ts.
All imports resolve without runtime errors in a dev server (next dev) and type errors are not reported.

title: Navbar sticky behavior and visibility across breakpoints
description: Verify the Navbar remains sticky at the top and displays expected elements across mobile, tablet, and desktop viewports.

steps.description: Open the landing page in desktop (>= 1280px), tablet (768-1023px), and mobile (<= 375px) viewports.
Navbar is fixed/sticky at the top and visible after scrolling on all viewports.
Contact CTA button is visible in desktop and tablet header; on mobile, hamburger icon is visible and contact CTA accessible inside mobile menu.

title: Mobile hamburger menu open/close and focus management
description: Ensure the hamburger toggles the mobile nav, focus shifts appropriately, ESC closes menu, and aria attributes reflect state.

steps.description: Set viewport to mobile size and navigate to the homepage.
Activate the hamburger button (click or keyboard Enter).
Mobile menu panel becomes visible, hamburger button aria-expanded attribute updates to true, and focus moves into the first interactive item in the menu.
Press Tab to cycle through menu items and then press Escape.
Menu closes, hamburger aria-expanded returns to false, and focus returns to the hamburger button.

title: Hero CTAs and anchor navigation
description: Verify primary CTAs in the Hero navigate to correct anchors and the animated mockup is present.

steps.description: Load the landing page and locate Hero section CTAs (e.g., Learn more, Contact).
Click 'Learn more'â€”expect smooth scroll to Features/HowItWorks section.
Page scrolls to the expected section and the URL hash (if used) or visible heading corresponds to the target.
Click 'Contact' CTA in hero.
Contact Modal opens and the animated app mockup remains visible; hero entrance animations triggered on initial load are complete without breaking layout.

title: Smooth scrolling behavior (Lenis) on supported browsers
description: Verify Lenis-driven smooth scrolling provides smooth transitions and scroll-triggered animations fire at expected positions on a modern browser.

steps.description: Open the site on a modern desktop browser and scroll slowly from top to bottom using the mouse wheel and keyboard arrow/PageDown keys.
Scroll motion appears smooth, no jank or stutter noted during normal navigation, and scroll-linked animations trigger when their sections enter the viewport.
Programmatically jump to an anchor link and observe behavior.
Anchor navigation is smooth and lands at the correct section; no content is obscured by the sticky navbar.

title: Smooth scrolling graceful degradation (reduced-motion or JS disabled)
description: Verify that when smooth-scrolling is unavailable (reduced-motion preference or disabled JS), navigation still functions and content remains accessible.

steps.description: Simulate user-agent reduced-motion: set prefers-reduced-motion to reduce and reload page.
Scrolling behavior respects reduced-motion (animations reduced or disabled) while content remains reachable and readable.
Disable JavaScript in the browser and reload the page.
Anchor links still navigate to content (non-JS fallback) and the mobile menu and modal degrade gracefully (modal may open as a new page or fallback UI); page remains usable.

title: GSAP scroll-triggered animations fire correctly
description: Verify GSAP animations for section entrances and mockup interactions trigger at intended scroll positions and do not cause layout shifts.

steps.description: Open the site on desktop and scroll to each section (Hero, Problem, Solution, Features, How It Works, Pricing, FAQ) slowly and also jump to anchors.
Each GSAP animation starts when its trigger enters the viewport and completes; animated elements end in expected final positions and do not overlap other content.
No unexpected cumulative layout shift (CLS) events caused by animation start/finish positions.

title: Contact Modal opening/closing via Zustand store
description: Verify global Zustand store controls opening and closing of Contact Modal predictably from header CTA, hero CTA, and programmatic store changes.

steps.description: From the page, click the header contact CTA to open modal.
Modal opens and store state indicates open (verify via unit test or exposing store getter in test environment).
Close the modal using the close button and then open it via the hero CTA.
Modal toggles accordingly and store state reflects the current visibility consistently.
Programmatically set store state (in test) to open and then to closed.
Modal UI updates match the programmatic state changes.

title: Contact Modal keyboard accessibility and ARIA
description: Ensure the Contact Modal is keyboard operable, focus-trapped when open, ESC closes it, and ARIA attributes (role, aria-modal, aria-labelledby) are set.

steps.description: Open the Contact Modal via CTA.
Focus is trapped inside the modal; Tab cycles through inputs and buttons without moving to background page controls.
Press Escape key.
Modal closes and focus returns to the element that triggered it; modal element has role='dialog' (or equivalent) and aria-modal='true' and an aria-labelledby referencing the modal title.

title: Contact Modal Zod validation - required fields
description: Verify client-side Zod schema enforces required fields and displays inline error messages for missing required values.

steps.description: Open Contact Modal and submit the form with all required fields empty.
Zod validation runs client-side and shows inline error messages for each required field; form is not submitted to the backend.
Run unit tests directly against the Zod schema with an input object missing required properties.
Schema.validate or parse returns expected failure with error details for each missing key.

title: Contact Modal Zod validation - invalid email and field constraints
description: Verify Zod enforces email format, maximum lengths, and other constraints; invalid inputs show helpful messages.

steps.description: Enter an invalid email (e.g., 'user@@example' or 'plainstring') and fill other required fields validly, then submit.
Inline error message indicates invalid email format and prevents submission.
Enter excessively long strings for text fields (beyond expected max) and submit.
Validation fails with messages about length constraints and input is not accepted.

title: Contact Modal XSS and input sanitization (client-side checks)
description: Ensure form input is not rendered in a way that allows script execution and that client-side displays escape potentially dangerous input.

steps.description: In a test environment, input a script-like string into a free-text field (e.g., '<script>alert(1)</script>') and submit (without sending to real backend).
The app displays the value as escaped text in any client-side success/preview and does not execute scripts; no inline script tags are injected into the DOM.
Run automated DOM inspection for innerHTML usage on client rendering paths of user-supplied values.
No unsafe innerHTML with unsanitized user content is used by the Contact Modal component.

title: Contact Modal submission success and UI state transitions
description: Verify valid form submission triggers the expected success state, clears errors, and allows retry or further action; handle mocked API success path.

steps.description: Open Contact Modal, fill in valid form values, and submit. Mock or stub the API endpoint to return success (200).
Form submission triggers success UI (toast/success screen), inline errors are cleared, submit button is disabled during request and re-enabled or replaced with 'Sent' state after success.
Attempt to open modal again and submit a different valid payload.
Modal accepts new submission and shows appropriate state transitions again.

title: Contact Modal submission failure handling (server error)
description: Verify UI shows an appropriate error message and allows retry when API returns error or network fails.

steps.description: Open Contact Modal, fill valid data, submit while mocking API to return 500 or network timeout.
UI displays a clear error message describing the failure, submit button becomes re-enabled for retry, and error is logged to console (in debug builds) or surfaced to monitoring hooks.
Retry submission and mock a successful response on retry.
Successful retry transitions to success UI and clears error messages.

title: Pricing cards CTA and content rendering
description: Verify pricing cards render with correct content, price, feature list, and CTA buttons that trigger expected navigation or modal open.

steps.description: Scroll to Pricing section and inspect each pricing card's displayed plan name, price, key features, and CTA button.
Each pricing card displays expected content and CTA is keyboard-focusable and clickable.
Click primary CTA on a pricing card (e.g., 'Contact Sales' or 'Get Started').
Action triggers expected behavior: either navigates to sign-up/checkout anchor or opens contact modal if configured.

title: FAQ accordion expand/collapse and accessibility
description: Ensure accordion entries expand/collapse with animation, maintain correct ARIA attributes (aria-expanded, aria-controls), and content is available to screen readers.

steps.description: Navigate to FAQ section and interact with each accordion header via mouse click and keyboard (Enter/Space).

When opened, aria-expanded is true, the content region is revealed and has aria-hidden=false (or appropriate), focus remains on the header unless explicitly moved, and the animated expansion completes without clipping content.
Use a screen reader to read an FAQ entry and confirm it reads header and content when expanded.
Screen reader announces the header and content appropriately and announcements update on expand/collapse.

title: Features grid and How It Works content responsiveness
description: Verify Features grid and 3-step How It Works guide maintain readability and layout across breakpoints and on narrow viewports do not overflow horizontally.

steps.description: Open the Features and HowItWorks sections on desktop, tablet, and mobile viewports and rotate orientation (portrait/landscape) for mobile.
Grid reflows appropriately (e.g., 3-column -> 1-column), icons and text scale via Tailwind utilities, and no horizontal scrollbars appear.
Simulate long localized strings for headings and descriptions using test content.
UI accommodates longer content without breaking layout or truncating important information unexpectedly.

title: Keyboard navigation across the page and skip-to-content
description: Ensure full keyboard navigation flow: skip links (if present), tab order, focus indicators visible, and interactive elements reachable in logical order.

steps.description: Load page and press Tab repeatedly from the top to move through interactive elements.
Focus moves in a logical order: skip link (if present) -> navbar items -> hero CTAs -> section links -> footer; focus indicators are visible for all interactive elements.
Activate skip-to-content link (if implemented).
Focus moves directly to main content area and the element receives focus as expected.

title: Performance audit for Core Web Vitals baseline
description: Run Lighthouse or automated performance analysis to capture LCP, INP/FID, and CLS and ensure they meet defined performance budgets for a marketing landing page.

steps.description: Run Lighthouse (or CI-based lab test) on the landing page in simulated mobile and desktop throttled conditions and collect LCP, INP/FID, and CLS scores.

Report generated contains Core Web Vitals metrics; each metric falls within acceptable thresholds defined by the team (e.g., LCP < 2.5s desktop lab baseline, CLS < 0.1). If thresholds are exceeded, document remediation items.

title: E2E flow: open Contact Modal, submit valid data, and confirm submission path
description: End-to-end test that simulates a real user opening the modal from header, filling valid data, and asserting the mocked backend receives the request and UI shows success.

steps.description: Start E2E runner (Playwright/Cypress), navigate to landing page, click header Contact CTA to open modal.
Fill required fields with valid test data and submit. Intercept network call to the configured API endpoint and assert payload matches expected schema.
API call is made with correct JSON body, UI shows a success state, and modal closes or transitions to success UI per implementation.

title: Unit tests: Zustand store transitions and selectors
description: Unit test the Zustand store functions for toggling modal state and retrieving modal visibility and submission status.

steps.description: In unit test environment, import lib/store and call actions to openModal(), closeModal(), setSubmitting(true/false), and resetState().
Store state updates synchronously/transactionally as expected: isOpen toggles, isSubmitting toggles, and subscribers receive updates; selectors return correct values.

title: CI build and lint pipeline verification
description: Ensure the project builds successfully in CI, linter and formatter checks pass, and no TypeScript errors block deployment.

steps.description: Run CI pipeline steps locally: npm ci, npm run build (Next.js production build), npm run lint, and npm run type-check (if separate).
Build completes successfully, lint reports zero errors (or only allowed warnings), and type-check passes with no errors. Artifacts are produced for preview deployment.
